Compass is building the first modern end-to-end real estate platform by integrating agents, buyers and sellers through technology. Before Compass, no one has achieved the blend of the Natural Intelligence that hundreds of thousands of enterprising real estate agents bring to this market, with the Artificial Intelligence that cloud, mobile and AI technologies enable.
As one of the fastest growing technology companies of our generation, in an industry larger than any other, we have an opportunity and obligation to build a world-class engineering team and the operating platform that will transform the real estate industry. In 2019 we tripled the size of our Product & Engineering team, and are searching for creative and inspiring colleagues at all levels of the organization to join us as we continue to expand in 2020.
The Data Product team's mission is to envision, build, and deploy the next generation end-to-end platform for real estate data ingestion, processing, storage, serving, and analysis at massive scale to provide leverage for Compass. Every team and agent at Compass relies on our platform to make data-informed decisions as they grow their business on top of this strong foundation.
About This Role
In this role, you will help Compass become the leading source of real estate information by expanding our geographic coverage, introducing new data types and sources, and ensuring the highest data quality standards are met. You will work cross-functionally with company leadership, product managers, engineers, support teams, and other analysts to grow and maintain the Compass data platform.
Responsibilities
Support our expansion team in efficiently onboarding new data sources with a high bar for quality
Create, test, monitor, and improve key data quality metrics tied to the customer experience
Serve as a subject matter expert and escalation point on data quality issues reported by front-line customer and product support teams
Directly interface with third party data sources during onboarding and change or incident management activities
Create and maintain operational and analytical scripts, or other tools to swiftly resolve data quality issues or drive actionable decision-making
Leverage data to build conviction and consensus around prioritizing platform features that improve the customer experience and scale the business
Confirm feature release readiness by performing ad hoc analyses and tests in support of new product development
Advocate for process improvements to drive our data platform forward with a metrics-driven, continuous improvement approach
What We Look For
2+ years experience in software product, project management, or engineering roles, building and launching successful data-driven products at scale
Experience manipulating large datasets using various tools or techniques, including Python/Google Apps scripting, SQL, pivot tables, lookups
Looking for people with expertise in data forensics, and who are detail-oriented, outstanding communicators, and are quick to learn new technologies/concepts
Preference given to candidates with 2+ years experience designing, implementing, and maintaining databases and/or data conversion/ETL pipelines
B.A., B.S., or similar degree in a technical discipline (Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics) is strongly preferred
Experience with developer tools and platforms (Github, AWS, Airflow) a plus
Experience in data science, or analytics is a plus
Knowledge of, or prior experience with, real estate data integrations is a plus
At Compass, our mission is to help everyone find their place in the world. This means we continually celebrate the diverse community different individuals cultivate. As an equal opportunity employer, we stay true to our mission by ensuring that our place can be anyone's place.

Job Description

Dr. John T. Farrar's Lab is hiring two (2) data analyst to participate in ongoing research on the re-analysis of randomized clinical trials of therapies used to treat acute pain and the development of prediction models to identify patients most likely to respond to such therapies. Duties include: (1) Locate, organize, catalogue, and define data in the FDA Document Archiving, Reporting and Regulatory Tracking System (DAARTS) system for all clinical trials on treatments of acute pain; (2) Processing, harmonizing, management, and analysis of data identified in step 1 by specific treatment, treatment group, and of the complete data set; and (3) Contributing to the development and testing of novel approaches to the harmonization and analysis of this complex data set.

The Data Analyst in particular will require management, processing, and review of analyses performed on a large-scale with multiple study goals. The lab will benefit from close collaboration with talented programmers, analysts, and faculty, and offers opportunities for career development and academic advancement at PSOM.

This position is contingent on continued funding.

Qualifications
A Bachelor's Degree in epidemiology, bioinformatics, statistics, medicine, biology or other related fields and minimum 2 years of experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience required. Experience with management and analysis of large complex data set harmonization and integration required. Familiarity with R, SAS, Stata, or other data analysis or data handling software strongly preferred.

Job Title: Health Data Analyst I, II or III
Job Description:
About The Company:
PEHP Health & Benefits is a division of the Utah Retirement Systems that proudly serves Utah’s public employees through high quality and competitively priced medical, dental, life, and long-term disability insurance plans on a self-funded basis. As a government entity, we embrace both a public mission and a commitment to creating customer value, excelling in the market, and improving healthcare. We offer a competitive salary with generous benefits, personal development in a positive team environment, and excellent work-life balance.

POSITION SUMMARY
Performs data analysis on healthcare data using database queries, spreadsheets, and data visualization software. Responsible for highlighting insights, key takeaways and summarizing results from large datasets in a manner that is easy to understand. Plays an important role in supporting the reporting function for recurring external group reports.

We are actively recruiting for this position. Interviews will be conducted virtually.
Also, due to COVID-19, this position will work remotely until our Office re-opens.
Job Description:
Health Data Analyst I
Non-Exempt Position

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS AND DUTIES
Writes SQL queries to pull data (medical, pharmacy and dental claims; eligibility; premium; lab results & biometrics; predictive model outputs like risk scores and risk of hospitalization measures). Optimizes queries for speed and ensures the accuracy of the data.
Defines the scope of the data analytic requests by clarifying and documenting what questions the end-user is trying to answer and how the results of the analysis will be used after it is delivered. After completion of analysis, performs necessary follow-up to ensure analysis meets expectations and that end-user understands how to interpret it.
Builds visually intuitive Tableau dashboards that are easy to use to answer likely questions from the end-user. Optimizes visualization speed with common filter interactions. Sets up automatic data refreshes, trains end-user in any functionality of dashboard, and schedules regular follow-ups with end-users to see if there are questions or feedback.
Uses Excel to perform advanced ad hoc analytical projects that involve text parsing, lookups, pivot tables, and graphs in a timely manner.
Assists in updating recurring reports. Investigates and takes action to correct any discrepancy in the data to ensure the integrity of the reports.
Presents data and conclusions to department and manager for peer review.
Finds meaningful insights from large data sets and assigned analytical assignments and succinctly summarizes and presents conclusions and key takeaways to others.
Finds ways to automate and streamline projects and reports that are commonly recurring.
Maintains strict confidentiality.
Performs other related duties as required.
Health Data Analyst II
Non-Exempt Position

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS AND DUTIES
Uses looped queries and/or stored procedures to build extracts to support data visualizations. Writes SQL queries to pull data (medical, pharmacy and dental claims; eligibility; premium; lab results & biometrics; predictive model outputs like risk scores and risk of hospitalization measures). Optimizes queries for speed and ensures the accuracy of the data.
Defines the scope of the data analytic requests by clarifying and documenting what questions the end-user is trying to answer and how the results of the analysis will be used after it is delivered. After completion of analysis, performs necessary follow-up to ensure analysis meets expectations and that the end-user understands how to interpret it.
Uses statistical analysis to create and/or apply predictive analytics that improves the underwriting, clinical/case management, or provider relations contracting/management processes.
Builds and supports advanced Tableau dashboards that are stable tools for other departments within PEHP and are regularly being enhanced based on the end-users’ feedback.
Helps build, manage, and/or enhance UW models (manual rate, risk score, small-group automated and large group stand-alones). Helps build, manage, and/or enhance data analysis that supports the UW process (e.g. trend driver, UW dashboard, etc.).
Presents data and conclusions to other departments within PEHP.
Investigates and takes action to correct any discrepancy in the data to ensure the integrity of the reports.
Finds ways to automate and streamline projects and reports that are commonly recurring.
Maintains strict confidentiality.
Performs other related duties as required.
Health Data Analyst III
Exempt Position

POSITION SUMMARY
Performs complex analysis on healthcare data using database queries, spreadsheets, programming languages, statistical software, and data visualization software. Responsible for highlighting insights, key takeaways, and summarizing results from large datasets in a manner that is easy to understand and digest for internal and external audiences.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS AND DUTIES
Develops predictive analytics to support actionable insights, allocate limited resources, and help guide rate setting process. Uses familiarity with healthcare data to extract and summarize the appropriate data elements for statistical model. Uses statistical software to construct, validate, and tune a predictive model. Implements model results into business processes.
Acts as content expert for data related to the assigned PEHP internal customer area. Supports PEHP internal customer area in reporting, research, data exploration, and embedding actionable data insights into business workflow. Gains familiarity of relevant data sources and writes SQL queries/stored procedures to extract and analyze data. Builds dashboards and/or other tools or reports as requested by the customer. May involve statistical analysis to verify/highlight potential insights from data.
Provides analytical support of PEHP enterprise level initiatives. Works with databases, software programming, and or statistical analysis to help develop analytical tools that help support the division’s strategic initiatives.
Presents technical results to non-technical audience. Clearly articulates, summarizes, and describes technical concepts in a way that non-technical audience can understand. Uses data visualizations and summaries to intuitively highlight key takeaways.
Supports internal and external reporting. Supports annual HEDIS reports and the accompanying audit, actionable insight report design, and implementation for employer groups, and/or automation of regular periodic reports to both internal/external customers.
Mentors, supports, and provides guidance to Health Data Analysts I and II, as assigned.
Supports underwriting functions as needed.
Maintains strict confidentiality.
Performs other related duties as required.
Required Experience:
Health Data Analyst I
Education and Experience
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative or clinical field and one (1) year of data analysis experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Knowledge of Tableau is preferred. Experience related to health care or data formats associated with medical, pharmacy and dental claims is preferred. Extensive knowledge of SQL and/or programming (VBA, Python or similar languages) is preferred.

This list contains knowledge, skills, and abilities that are typically associated with the job. It is not all-inclusive and may vary from position to position:

Required technical skills include the working knowledge and ability of:
Fundamental understanding of SQL query writing and statistical analysis.
Intermediate knowledge of Microsoft Excel, specifically pivot tables and intermediate formulas.
Tableau.
Required mathematical skills include working knowledge of:
Building and reviewing statistical models.
Estimating confidence intervals.
Being able to read and apply emerging analytical methods.

Must possess excellent communication skills:
Communicate effectively, verbally and in writing.
Develop and deliver presentations.

Must have the ability to:
Follow written and verbal instructions.
Prioritize work.
Perform within deadlines.
Analyze problems and data.
Use sound judgment in decision making and problem solving.
Work well in a team environment as well as independently.
Multi-task by handling a variety of duties in a timely and efficient manner.

Through clinical services, education and research, The Family Institute at Northwestern University is one of the nation’s leading relationship-based behavioral health organizations committed to strengthening and healing children and adolescents, couples, families and individuals. Are you excited to join a mission-based organization that values a high-performing, collaborative culture? Reporting to the Vice President, Information Systems and Security Officer, this role is responsible for using a combination of business intuition and analytical expertise to provide executive and service line leadership with actionable insights to drive strategic decision-making while ensuring data quality and analytical accuracy. The candidate in this role will be critical in analyzing, aggregating and building a data ecosystem from the ground up that will assist in furthering The Family Institute as a data-driven organization. This role requires the ability to respond to the live needs of the business; help solve problems and answer questions as they arise; and holds strong technical abilities to retrieve, manipulate, analyze and visualize data, but also excellent communication capabilities to stakeholders of all levels and skills.
Department
Information Technology
Reports To
Vice President, Information Systems and Security Officer
FLSA Status
Exempt
Primary Responsibilities
Develops a data infrastructure across our organization that allows data to drive business and programmatic decision making.
Builds relationships across departments to understand user needs for data.
Creates, develops and maintains reports, datasets, ad hoc requests, dashboards, metrics, data generators, etc. for end-users using system tools and databases. Produce actionable reports that show key performance indicators, identify areas of improvement into current operations, and display root cause analysis of problems.
Analyzes and determines data needs for end-users. Accesses, extracts and integrates data from diverse sources residing on multiple platforms and implement data models by combining, synthesizing and structuring data.
Conduct data analysis and capture, develop and document data definitions, business rules and data quality requirements.
Ensure data integrity, consistency and reliability by implementing quality assurance practices; performs quality data audits and analysis. Identify areas of improvement in data collection processes or systems and make recommendations to correct deficiencies.
As a subject matter expert, utilizes analytical tools to perform quantitative analysis. Interpret data, analyze results, and identifies key data insights to address specific business questions and highlights findings and implications of analysis to The Family Institute’s stakeholders.
Provides quantitative and qualitative data analysis and reporting of patterns, insights and trends to decision-makers in order to drive business decisions and address business questions.
Summarizes analysis into user-friendly deliverables by translating detailed data into business-appropriate communication and recommendations.
Applies new perspectives, creative problem solving and inter-departmental connections to improve analytical capabilities.
Takes initiatives to design and develop deliverables based on interpretation of findings and business client needs on a wide range of analytical topics.
Creates and is accountable for high quality, value driven work that drives business outcomes and data driven decisions.
Education/Experience
Bachelor’s degree required; emphasis in Mathematics, Statistics, Information Technology or Healthcare Technology. A strong understanding and management of healthcare related applications and data is a plus.
Proven experience, ideally in healthcare, with granular data analysis, predictive analytics or analytics technology products. Hands-on experience reading/writing code in a data analyst role.
Fluency in SQL or other similar programming languages. Some development experience in at least one scripting language (Python, R, etc.) is a plus.
Experience with data visualization and tools such as SPSS, SASS and PowerBI.
Experience launching internal metric dashboards and scorecards. You are a data-storyteller who is comfortable communicating results in a crisp and effective manner to all audiences (technical and non-technical).
Strong analytical skills and can evangelize the use of data for sound decision making across functions. Strong oral and written communication skills, and ability to collaborate with, and influence cross-functional partners.
Self-motivated, self-directed and able to thrive in a fast-paced environment in an industry that constantly changes.
A mindset of designing for the future but building for now. An eagerness to learn from others and help others grow with you. A love of data and finding interesting questions to ask of it.

Nike’s HR Global Analytics function is a growing team responsible for building and deepening a holistic view of Nike’s workforce through data and analytics and applying those insights to inform the development, evolution and transformation of our workforce. Using channels ranging from qualitative to quantitative, and data across all facets of HR, our team connects the science and art of Nike to the hearts and minds of our teams around the world!

We are looking for team members to accelerate our Workforce & People Reporting and Analytics impact. You’ll be at the center of a broad range of data and information spanning across all areas of HR and will be responsible for crafting and delivering reporting, BI and analytical solutions to HR and the enterprise – focused on data and visualization solutions to be delivered. You’ll be central to supporting, and powering, these solutions.

You’re someone who has a deep passion for igniting business decisions and actions through data, you thrive at the intersection of business and data and can articulate how we can best bring our data to life through varied channels of reporting and syndication (direct access capabilities, dashboards, reports and other solutions).

You will become an invaluable data analyst to our HR function by delivering solutions to answer sophisticated business questions and you’ll work across our analytics teams to ensure there is a collective and holistic view to your work. Integrating data from various sources to produce requested or required data elements. Programming and maintaining report forms and formats, information dashboards, canned reports and other end- user information portals or resources. Also crafting specifications for reports based on business requests, documenting processes, and coordinating work with security and production support teams.

The ideal candidate excels in a cross-functional team environment and thrives in a fast-paced organization where there is an opportunity to make a positive impact. In this role, you’ll work across multiple HR Analytics and enterprise functions and can easily translate business opportunities back to data. You can see how we can demonstrate and extract maximum value from our data assets, translate that into what solutions can meet those needs.

Keys to success include a background in Data and Analytics and a solid understanding and curiosity of how HR value is built at a company like Nike. This position requires a positive, hardworking team player who thrives in an ambitious environment and you are excited by the challenge of bringing sophisticated data to light. You ask questions, are continually learning as well as finding opportunities to share knowledge with others. Your teams’ success is your success, and you actively seek out opportunities to be a good partner across the organization.
Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Statistics, Engineering or a related field.

High business acumen, with an affinity for data exploration, analysis, and working with business intelligence tools and large amounts of data.
Excellent communications skills (written and verbal) and strong interpersonal skills

EquipmentShare is Hiring a Financial Data Analyst


EquipmentShare is searching for a Data Analyst for the corporate office in Columbia, Missouri to help us drive profitability through data-driven analysis.

About EquipmentShare


EquipmentShare is dedicated to creating a connected jobsite for the modern contractor. We deliver user-friendly technology solutions that help contractors maximize their equipment uptime, reduce risk exposure and increase productivity. EquipmentShare's product offerings include an improved equipment rental experience, fleet tracking and asset management software, hardware security solutions and predictive service and maintenance applications.

EquipmentShare is the fastest-growing, independently owned construction equipment rental company in the country. We serve dozens of markets across the U.S. and are on track to create a national footprint in every major market in the country by the end of 2023. Our branch locations are equipped with a broad range of construction equipment, ranging from 150-foot telescopic booms to 120,000-lb. track excavators.

EquipmentShare's rapid growth goes beyond meeting a demand for equipment rentals in booming new markets. Instead, our mission begins with our rental product, and it's a testimony to our ability to improve industry standards and better serve the customer. Our expansion and customer retention is a validation of strong contractor demand for the smart jobsite technology we've built into our rental fleet. And it's just the beginning of our journey to establishing a global presence.

Your Opportunity to Grow With Us


The EquipmentShare team is a close-knit group of professionals who all share an interest in providing a service and product that improve our customer's experience. Above all, we care about building something people want, and the only way to do that is by assembling a skilled, passionate and talented team. Our mission is to improve productivity and efficiency throughout the entire construction industry, and our people are how we make achieving that goal possible.

We're seeking a Financial Data Analyst who loves a challenge and wants the opportunity to grow with a fast-paced company. Industry competitors often have layers of tenured management that create barriers to career advancement. The opportunity for career growth is unparalleled at EquipmentShare, where you'll find no shortage of challenging yet fulfilling work, chances to build new skills and supportive teammates who will push you to achieve your best.

Primary Responsibilities
Analyze a wide range of data, and turn that data into action, whether that looks like process improvements, best business practices or other data-backed solutions
Use your strong development and analytical skills to solve business problems across the company
Produce reports and models for senior leaders and other key team members
Identify trends, correlations and patterns in data, and present findings to stakeholder
About You


Our mission to change an entire industry is not easily achieved, so we only hire people who are inspired by the goal and up for the challenge. In turn, our employees have every opportunity to grow with us, achieve personal and professional success and enjoy making a tangible difference in an industry that's long been resistant to change.

Skills & Qualifications
Must be qualified to work in the United States - we are not sponsoring any candidates at this time.
2 years of experience in an analysis-focused role
Forecasting, reporting, and analysis experience
You have a proven ability to approach complex problems with curiosity and an analytical mindset.
You roll with the punches and can adapt quickly, manage competing projects and challenge the status quo.
A keen understanding of data interpretation and the ability to swiftly extract key insights
Expert-level Excel skills
SQL experience required
Preferably knowledge of an analytical language like Python, R, SAS, SPSS, etc.
Why We're a Better Place to Work
Competitive salary
Health insurance and medical coverage benefits
401(k)
Generous paid time off
Stocked breakroom and full kitchen
Free weekly team workout at a local gym
Volunteering and local charity initiatives that help you nurture and grow the communities you call home through EquipmentCare
Opportunities for career and professional development with conferences, events, seminars, continued education
Since our founding in 2015, we've had explosive growth—and we're not stopping anytime soon. Ready to invest in our mission, invest in yourself and discover a better place to work? Then we'd love to meet you. Apply today.

Description

Description/Comment :

Data Analyst - Medicaid

GENERAL FUNCTION

The Data Analyst will be responsible for ensuring processes and procedures are established to deliver provider data quality and serving as a key contributor for Medicaid Networks design, build and monitoring.
This includes the technical understanding of the provider information flow between enterprise systems and external state applications.
The Provider Ops Analyst will be hands on with updating necessary provider information.

MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Define standard processes and system enhancements to enable state validation of provider information and ongoing maintenance
Oversight of the provider Medicaid data integrity through monitoring data trends and identification of issues. This includes the day to day quality oversight as well as the system and batch processes validations.
Defines the resolution to data issues and ensures the provider data team executes as needed to adhere to quality standards and drives solutions to enhance system processes for more accurate flow of Medicaid information.
Defines and leads process design sessions with the team to develop efficient enterprise level business process that simplify work processes and deliver enhanced provider data management quality. Produces process design documents to solidify understanding.
Identify through self-driven queries/reports operational efficiencies and defines a plan to implement.
Serve as a contact for high level provider set up escalations due to Medicaid data discrepancies and claims fallout
Navigate large quantities of complicated data to derive root cause and impacts of data/process issues to the organization while adhering to regulatory and compliance requirements.
Ability to distill large data down and turn into meaningful information to drive decisions for leadership.
Ability to quantify the impact of the data issue for organizational prioritization using fact driven methodologies.
Acts as department subject matter expert for Medicaid related processes/changes
Provides analysis and recommendations on process improvements for all provider data processes as well as developing test plans and data to ensure process improvements are achieved as expected.
Advocate for change and driving different thought processes related to provider information.
Other projects/duties as assigned

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS :

Bachelor's Degree in a related field
Healthcare experience
Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills
Strong problem-solving, analysis and issue resolution skills
Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment, handle multiple assignments, establish priorities, and demonstrate excellent time management skills
Demonstrate thorough critical thinking skills to solidify understanding of bigger picture
Proficient in MS Office Applications and overall knowledge of enterprise systems (AS400, SAP, Facets)with ability to learn new software systems with intermediate to advance excel skills
Strong attention to detail
Self-driven desire to drive initiatives
Proficient in SQL, Business Objects

Note :

Hours: 8-5 pm (Flexible) - Mon-Fri

Data Analyst Description & Duties:

We are looking for a strong analyst to help drive profitable growth by leveraging data and analytics. This is a hands-on role requiring technical skills to query and manipulate data to develop data-driven reports and recommendations. The analyst will have a wide range of exposure to loan originations and servicing areas in consumer lending. The analyst will on a regular basis present reports, findings and recommendations to senior management to improve business strategies and practices

Duties may include, but are not limited to:
Dive into data and quickly become an expert on internal and non-traditional data sets. Maintain data and file integrity. Improve existing data query scripts and develop new ones as needed.
Create user-friendly reports and Tableau visualizations for staff and management. Enhance existing and build new Tableau dashboards as needed.
Track, review, manage and audit software development projects, particularly from database access and usage perspectives.
Work with staff, managers and executives on analytic projects and develop data-driven solutions and recommendations.

Bachelor's degree in Finance, Business, Economics or related field.
Hands-on familiarity with SQL data querying, coding experience and understanding of basic coding syntax.
Advanced Excel skills to create/edit pivot tables, understand/create/manipulate database formulas, create/modify macros (VBA knowledge preferred), adjust formatting to create professional reports.
Advanced data visualization skills, preferably with Tableau.
Must have the ability to research, think through and solve technical and analytic problems.
Strong communication skills, attention to detail, analytical curiosity is required.
Working Conditions:

Office environment with significant time spent sitting, typing and talking on the telephone.

Business Group Highlights

Defense

The Defense group supports the Department of Defense (DoD) mission to keep our homeland and its citizens safe. We provide solutions to improve the Nation's defense by providing software, systems engineering, IT, training and logistics and fleet management solutions.

Responsibilities

The successful Configuration Management Analyst will support a new program at Perspecta, focused on baseline establishment and management of a new Space Domain architecture. This CM Analyst will be responsible t establish the technical baseline including all cross-space and ground segment interfaces and to lower levels for interfaces considered to be key to inter- or intra-segment interoperability; Support baseline development for the Segments; Identify disconnects between segments and external agencies, and work the issues to closure; Develop system and segment level requirements that allow the Mission Users to effectively and efficiently interoperate and submit the requirements to the change process.

Baseline Management tasks include establish a formal process for capturing the baseline and managing changes and distribution; Employ this process to identify, control, maintain, make recommendations to evolve, and execute changes to technical baselines; Use change management software to mitigate the risk of unauthorized and unplanned changes to the technical baseline, including document content and the associated links; Provide user access to all databases used to manage the technical baseline; Perform requirements analysis in response to requested changes, addressing flow‐down, and changes to systems engineering products such as ICDs and verification plans; Maintain interface control for all ICDs/ISs that involve interaction between segments, contractors, or external agencies.

The CM Analyst Lead will organize, facilitate and provide agendas, briefings and minutes for all System and Segment level CM‐related boards, forums and working groups. The Lead is also responsible for mentoring and training more junior CM/DM support.

Qualifications

Requires 8 to 10 years with BS/BA or 6 to 8 years with MS/MA or 3 to 5 years with PhD, or equivalent work experience with at least 5 years experience leading a CM/DM Team.
Experience required supporting similar DoD or Space Domain Configuration Management Efforts
Expereince managing a small team of CM/DM professionals
Experience with agile COTS Configuration Management Tools
Minimum TS Clearance required

Cooper Tire offers an entirely unique work experience because no matter what your title is, you’ll play a part in contributing to the development, manufacturing and marketing of some of the most innovative tire products in the world. Cooper is a fun and exciting place to work. We are constantly on the lookout for motivated individuals who lead by example and inspire others to greatness. The opportunities are endless and the rewards rich for those who believe that job satisfaction and career success begin with a satisfied customer. Careers are a Journey…Come Ride with Us!

The IT Data Analyst is charged with effectively managing Cooper Tire & Rubber Company’s master data within its ERP/SAP systems. This position will be focused in the Global Operations space supporting the Manufacturing Plants, Corporate Purchasing and Corporate Quality globally but will have opportunities to cross-train in Customer, Material, and other master data functions.

Job Responsibilities:
Maintain data integrity to ensure that standards are being followed and data is consistently maintained and enhanced where possible to meet business needs.Define data standards where required coordinating with appropriate stakeholders.
Facilitate master data workflow processes by working directly with customers to ensure timely completion and process adherence.
Understanding of Technical business and strategy to execute and support the development and utilization of effective and insightful reports and visualizations.
Initiate and participate in projects or actions to improve the overall performance and quality of master data handling, including workflow development, data profiling, data score-carding and creation and maintenance of data dictionaries.
Provide on-demand/ad-hoc data manipulation/analysis as requested by Technical business.
Design of Technical Data Strategy based on Global strategy (IT and Global Operations).
Review requests for new or modified master data to ensure they are in line with business rules.
Respond to or appropriately redirect all Technical data requests.
Collaborate with other data analysts within IT and the businessareas globally to standardize data and set strategy to support all business analytics.
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Marketing, or Business related field
2+ years of experience in Data Management, Business Administration, Product development, Marketing/Customer Service
Strong communication skills and the ability to work with all levels of the business, employees, consultants, and contractors
Team oriented with the ability to promote the successful advancement of the group
High quality analytical skills, the ability to pay attention to details
Self-motivated and the capability to work with limited direction
Ability to identify priorities, deadlines, and expectations and execute assignments accordingly
Preferred Qualifications:
Green Belt Certification
Experience working with SAP Master Data & data structures
Experience with Winshuttle Foundation and Studio
Working knowledge of Service Now tools

At Capital One, data is at the center of everything we do. When we launched as a startup we disrupted the credit card industry by individually personalizing every credit card offer using statistical modeling and the relational database, cutting edge technology in 1988! Fast-forward a few years, and this little innovation and our passion for data has skyrocketed us to a Fortune 200 company and a leader in the world of data-driven decision-making.

As a Data Analyst at Capital One you will leverage analytic and technical skills to innovate, build, and maintain well-managed data solutions and capabilities to tackle business problems.

On any given day you will be challenged on three types of work – Innovation, Business Intelligence and Data Management:

Innovation
• Use Open Source/Digital technologies to mine complex, voluminous, and different varieties of data sources and platforms
• Build well-managed data solutions, tools, and capabilities to enable self-service frameworks for data consumers
• Demonstrate ability to explore and quickly grasp new technologies to progress varied initiatives

Business Intelligence
• Partner with the business to provide consultancy and translate the business needs to design and develop tools, techniques, metrics, and dashboards for insights and data visualization
• Drive analysis that provides meaningful insights on business strategies

Data Management
• Drive an understanding and adherence to the principles of data quality management including metadata, lineage, and business definitions
• Work collaboratively with appropriate Tech teams to manage security mechanisms and data access governance
• Build and execute tools to monitor and report on data quality

Our ideal candidate will have:
• Degree specialized in a Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics discipline
• Scripting experience in (Python, R, Spark, and SQL)
• Strong desire and experience with data in various forms (data warehouses/SQL, unstructured data)
• Experience utilizing and developing within AWS services

• Bachelor’s Degree
• At least 3 years of experience in at least one scripting language
• At least 1 year of experience utilizing a business intelligence visualization tool
• At least 3 years of experience in querying and analyzing and working with data languages and platforms

Preferred Qualifications:
• Master’s Degree in a Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics discipline
• At least 4 years of experience coding in Python, R, Spark, or SQL
• At least 4 years of experience working within process management and improvement methodologies – Agile, Lean, Six Sigma, etc.
• At least 2 years of experience utilizing and developing within AWS services
• At least 2 years of experience delivering Data Governance and Data Quality Management concepts and practices within the financial services industry

Job Title: Hazard Exposure Assessment Specialist- Data Analyst
Job Description:
Hazard Exposure Assessment Specialist- Data Analyst

Washington, DC, USA
Req #3137

Monday, October 5, 2020

Summary

The MEDSAFE program, established through the Bureau of Medical Services Division of Occupational Health and Wellness (OHW), is designed to identify, evaluate, and document site-specific occupational and environmental exposure risks to DOS employees by post, facility and/or operation. In addition, through this program OHW will establish an OEH monitoring system to document and track employee exposures during tenure (Individual Longitudinal Exposure Record ILER). Lastly, the MEDSAFE program is established to treat, monitor, and mitigate any long-term health consequences related to employment with Department of State.

The Exposure Assessment Specialist provides substantive expertise and support for identifying global sources of environmental data (e.g., air and water quality, indoor contaminants, infectious diseases, food safety, solid waste management) and analyzing data to characterize human exposures to environmental hazards spatially and temporally. The incumbent participates in applying scientific evidence to develop the ILER database as well as formulating, implementing, and evaluating policy and procedures to mitigate health risks based on the exposure estimates.

Duties/Responsibilities

• Identifies environmental data sources, analyzes and summarizes data, as well as identifies trends.

• Reviews and evaluates scientific studies to produce appropriate metrics to estimate human exposures and assess hazards to human health.

• Participates in creating and maintaining appropriate databases to track all pertinent information.

• Prepares reports and data visualizations to describe and communicate environmental data and human exposures via multi-media platforms.

• Conducts indoor and outdoor environmental monitoring studies, including gathering and analyzing data.

• Collaborates with all programs within Department of State to promote occupational safety and health, engage management in incorporating safety in all aspects of operations.

Qualifications:

Possess the following knowledge

• Environmental chemistry, environmental fate and transport modeling of contaminants within and across media, human health exposure pathways, and exposure modeling tools and equations

• Principles and practices of environmental science

• Scientific methods of environmental monitoring and human exposure assessment

• Human health exposure and risk assessment

• Sources of environmental data

• U.S. environmental standards and policies

Possess the following skills

• Conducting exposure assessment or environmental monitoring studies, including analyzing and summarizing data to produce science-based human exposure metrics.

• Critically evaluating scientific studies and drawing inferences about human exposures and hazards.

• Statistical analysis (e.g., SAS, R), database development, data visualization software.

• Presenting and explaining environmental data to audiences of varying backgrounds and write technical reports.

Security Clearance

A Secret clearance is required top secret preferred

Description

The Maryland-National Capital Park and Planning Commission, Prince George's County, Parks and Recreation, Management Services Division, Data & Relationship Management Section, is seeking to fill a Data Analyst (Class Spec – Systems Analyst) position. This position will work directly with the Data & Relationship Manager to create information from the vast amount of data collected in various systems.

There is a robust data infrastructure behind the vast and diverse Prince George’s Parks & Recreation system that provides quality recreation programs, facilities, and services for residents and visitors. The ideal candidate should be highly skilled in all aspects of data analytics, including mining, generation, and visualization. Additionally, the ideal candidate is committed to transforming data into readable, action-driven reports to support various Department goals that pertain to equity, urban parks, trails, and ballfields using multiple data sources.

Examples of Important Duties
Work closely with staff to understand their analytical needs, including identifying critical metrics and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).
Proactively analyze data to answer key questions from stakeholders and communicate areas for improvement in efficiency and productivity.
Work directly with management and users to gather requirements, provide status updates, and build relationships.
Develop, implement, and maintain leading-edge analytic systems, taking complicated problems and building simple frameworks.
Identify trends and opportunities for growth through analysis of complex data sets.
Evaluate current workflows and provide source-to-target mappings and information-model specification documents for data sets.
Create best-practice reports based on data mining, analysis, and visualization.
Create and maintain rich, interactive visualizations through data interpretation and analysis integrating various reporting components from multiple data source.
Minimum Qualifications

1. Bachelor's degree in business or public administration, information systems management, or a related field, and two years of varied experience in systems analysis and design, systems development, and data processing; or
An equivalent combination of education and experience.

About Us
Launched in 2011, Twitch is a global community that comes together each day to create multiplayer entertainment: unique, live, unpredictable experiences created by the interactions of millions. We bring the joy of co-op to everything, from casual gaming to world-class esports to anime marathons, music, and art streams. Twitch also hosts TwitchCon, where we bring everyone together to celebrate, learn, and grow their personal interests and passions. We're always live at Twitch. Stay up to date on all things Twitch on LinkedIn, Twitter and on our Blog.
About the Role
Twitch is looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join a small but agile team. You will work with the Customer Experience organization to lead thought, process and insight leadership. You will report into the Head of Customer Experience and will lead insight generation to inform our continuous improvement efforts and provide guidance on prioritization of improvement efforts multiple internal product or engineering teams.
As a Data Analyst in Customer Experience at Twitch, you will be on the ground floor with the Customer Experience team, shaping the way we work with the product teams, defining what questions are asked, and scaling analytics methods and tools to support our growing business. Additionally, you will help support the vision for Customer Experience and solutions architecture for data related voice of the customer constructs.. You are paving the way for high-quality, high velocity insight to support large-scale growth.
You Will:
Build Voice of the Customer reports and dashboards to communicate health of the customer experience across all company partners and senior leadership.
Collaboratively establish causal impact and incremental value of continuous improvement programs and report the total value across multiple cuts of data
Produce insights rapidly & periodically so teams can act on it with minimal lag
Produce custom deep-dive analyses outside the periodic insights process
Contribute to data pipelining, from data preparation to analysis to deployment and work with associated engineering teams and 3rd party measurement partners
Support efforts to resolve data quality issues by identifying the root-causes and presenting potential solutions.
Identify data automation opportunities and manage projects to refine the process by getting hands-on with the data stack and working with associated engineering teams
Work with other analysts to ensure data integrity and quality, and produce high-quality white papers to present and circulate across the organization
You Have:
4+ years of industry experience in a relevant field
Expert SQL skills-your ability to tap into our data pipeline will be key to your success
Experience using data to produce insight and achieve our goals
Fluency in data analysis and communication around data, including time series analysis, experimentation, forecasting, data visualization, and defining Goal strategy for your business

Job Title: BLC Data Validation Analyst - Auburn Hills, MI
Job Description:
BLC Data Validation Analyst
The BLC Data Validation Analyst is a member of the BLC Account Management team and is responsible for ensuring all information entered into the systems of record is accurate and complete for all loan applications.
Position Competencies
Successful incumbents possess integrity and trust, listening skills, problem solving skills, are focused on the customer, have a drive for results and strong business acumen and are excellent at prioritizing and managing work.
Position Responsibilities:
The Data Validation Analyst analyzes and validates loan approval data for commercial and consumer loans enrolled in BLC Account Management.
Uses knowledge of underwriting principals and the end-to-end loan process to review, analyze and interpret information in the Recap. Translates the information into what is required to be captured in the system of record.
Ensures compliance with established service objectives in accordance with procedures, corporate policies, legal guidelines, credit and lending policies, and applicable Federal and State Laws.
Gathers and enters into the system of record required data that is not included in the RECAP from various internal and external sources. Engages, interacts and/or consults with peers, other LTS departments, credit administration, relationship managers, legal counsel, customers and vendors.
Initiates direct communication, verbally and in writing, with credit support, relationship managers, internal and external legal counsel, customers, vendors, etc. to collect, validate and enter, into the system the required information to document, board and provide accurate reporting on Commercial/Consumer loans.
Maintains relationships and effectively encourages collaboration to provide quality customer service working diligently to meet internal and external deadlines.
Develops knowledge and understanding of support and loan documents required for the borrowing entity, collateral type and loan controls and/or covenants contained in the credit approval for various Commercial and Consumer loans.
Gathers and ensures accuracy of final documentation post-closing.
Understands and maintains knowledge of legal and regulatory issues to assess degree of risk in information obtained for various Commercial and Consumer loans.
Ensures all key operational metrics, particularly in the areas of service quality, productivity and overall efficiency are met.
Reviews available internal and external information to ensure all loans eligible for BLC enrollment are properly enrolled in a timely manner.

Position Qualifications
High School Diploma OR equivalent
6 years of banking OR Financial service environment experience
3 years of commercial loan experience
3 years of analysis experience
3 years of customer service experience on a telephone and face-to-face environment
1 year of legal training, credit college training, or comparable commercial banking experience
1 year of experience with relevant banking, regulatory and end-to-end loan process matters
1 year of experience with PC based mainframe systems, loan accounting system (AFS), and DEALS
1 year of experience utilizing Microsoft Office Products including Word, Excel and Power Point
Comerica Oaktec Building
8:00am - 5:00pm Monday - Friday

Data Analyst
Position Summary
We have a need for Data Analyst with experience in data analytics and metrics optimization. We will need you to assist in collecting data and putting it to practical use, with the end goal of maximizing profits and increasing our efficiency. We are interested in furthering our data collection and analysis practices, so you will recommend new data procedures and programs. You’ll be responsible for processing several different types of data, including those related to our website and online presence, and our multi-channel marketing campaigns and launches.
Responsibilities
As our Data Analyst, you will report to the Director of Marketing Technology. Your role will be to work across the marketing organization and cross-functional teams (IT, sales operations, finance, and CRM salesforce) to gather, analyze and share qualitative and quantitative analysis.
Evaluate the multichannel impact of marketing activities on engagement, sales and ROI
Develop and refine techniques used to measure engagement, conversion and trends for marketing efforts, including campaigns and ongoing programs
Create a baseline marketing performance and build a process to streamline measurement
Ensure timely delivery of reporting and insights, and build user-friendly answers to basic marketing questions (e.g., executive dashboards)
Use data mining and other analytical techniques to gain insight into customers to improve the effectiveness of communications and products
Improve the presentation and communication of marketing analytics across the organization
Benchmark marketing metrics against relevant standards and competitors
Identify and suggest optimization opportunities to appropriate executional teams
Conduct other ad-hoc analysis and reporting on request
Required Qualifications
Our ideal candidate will have three years of professional experience with marketing data at an investment firm or in a financial services company’s investment unit.
Strong background in quantitative analysis (e.g., statistics, finance, mathematics or economics)
Ability to aggregate, standardize, interpret and model data, and to work independently within a decentralized environment
Analytic modeling using methods such as basic statistics, software-assisted segmentation and linear regression
Digital marketing platform skills, including common website analytics platforms, widely used ad serving and technology platforms, social listening and analytics platforms, and mobile site and mobile app analytics platforms
Advanced Excel skills (pivots, tables and functions)
Familiarity with database queries and programming languages (e.g., SQL)
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to convey complex ideas clearly and to communicate with both technical and nontechnical audiences
Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Operations Research or relevant experience

SUMMARY

Performs analysis and validation of complex and varied healthcare and cost data to identify statistically significant, actionable variation. Performs exploratory data analysis, uncovers trends, identifies root cause and relationships. This position requires understanding of CARF requirements and facilitates the coordination of regulatory compliance activities relative to CARF survey preparation follow up, mock surveys. Collaborates with Nursing leaders and physician leaders to investigate hunches about care variation that leads to cost and/or outcomes opportunities. Creates data analytics dashboards that allow system and service line leaders to identify variation, trends, cost and outcomes improvement opportunities and process sustainability. Identifies operational process improvement opportunities across our operational functions using data analysis and contribute those related projects. Assists with identifying areas to include in strategic planning to achieve operational goals and targets. Monitors and manages operational metrics and summarizes recommendations to plan and modify or realign resources as required to meet the objectives. Facilitates using LEAN, Six Sigma and other quality improvement methodologies to process analysis of opportunities, barriers, and efficiency.

EDUCATION

Bachelors degree in computer science, computer engineering, engineering management, or related field required. Master's preferred. Foreign equivalency accepted.

LICENSURE

Lean Six Sigma Belt certification required.

EXPERIENCE

Minimum of 2 years of clinical data analytical experience in hospital setting. Minimum 1 year operational experience in healthcare settings (Post-Acute preferred).

OTHER QUALIFICATIONS

Working knowledge of appropriate CARF regulations and information. Stong Excel and other data analytics software applications.

Who We Are

Based in California, AeroVironment (AVAV) is a global leader in unmanned aircraft systems (UAS) and tactical missile systems. Founded in 1971 by celebrated physicist and engineer, Dr. Paul MacCready, we’ve been at the leading edge of technical innovation for more than 45 years. Be a part of the team that developed the world’s most widely used military drones and created the first submarine-launched reconnaissance drone, and has seven innovative vehicles that are part of the Smithsonian Institution’s permanent collection in Washington, DC.

Join us today in developing the next generation of small UAS and tactical missile systems that will deliver more actionable intelligence to our customers so they can proceed with certainty – and succeed.

What We Do

Building on a history of technological innovation, AeroVironment designs, develops, produces, and supports an advanced portfolio of unmanned aircraft systems (UAS) and tactical missile systems. Agencies of the U.S. Department of Defense and allied military services use the company’s hand-launched UAS to provide situational awareness to tactical operating units through real-time, airborne reconnaissance, surveillance, and target acquisition.

AeroVironment Incorporated is an equal opportunity employer, M/F/D/V and works in compliance with both federal and state laws. We are committed to the concept regarding Equal Employment opportunity. Qualified candidates will be considered for employment regardless of race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, marital status, medical condition nor disability, genetics, veteran and all others that may appy.

Job Title: Data Analyst/Data Migration Engineer - MVNO Administration
Job Description:
Data Analyst/Data Migration Engineer

Our client is south Denver, CO is building a next-gen 5G network to disrupt the wireless industry and fuel innovation in transportation, health care, education, sustainability, city management, and agriculture.

They are need need of a strong Data Analyst/Data Migration Engineer who will support their new Wireless MVNO Retail organization.

Job Responsibilities include:
Working with Vendors and Business Stakeholders to ensure needs are met.
Support Enterprise Data Migration for Wireless Business
Write Data Mapping Requirements
Be liaison between technical teams and business
Technical Skills:
5+ years experience in Data migration and Analytics
Relational Database Development using SQL
ETL experience with Informatica
Amdocs- Ensemble experience is a PLUS
Cloud CI/CD experience (Hadoop, NoSQL, Oracle, etc.)
Wireless/Telecom experience

Data Analyst
Position Summary
We have a need for Data Analyst with experience in data analytics and metrics optimization. We will need you to assist in collecting data and putting it to practical use, with the end goal of maximizing profits and increasing our efficiency. We are interested in furthering our data collection and analysis practices, so you will recommend new data procedures and programs. You’ll be responsible for processing several different types of data, including those related to our website and online presence, and our multi-channel marketing campaigns and launches.
Responsibilities
As our Data Analyst, you will report to the Director of Marketing Technology. Your role will be to work across the marketing organization and cross-functional teams (IT, sales operations, finance, and CRM salesforce) to gather, analyze and share qualitative and quantitative analysis.
Evaluate the multichannel impact of marketing activities on engagement, sales and ROI
Develop and refine techniques used to measure engagement, conversion and trends for marketing efforts, including campaigns and ongoing programs
Create a baseline marketing performance and build a process to streamline measurement
Ensure timely delivery of reporting and insights, and build user-friendly answers to basic marketing questions (e.g., executive dashboards)
Use data mining and other analytical techniques to gain insight into customers to improve the effectiveness of communications and products
Improve the presentation and communication of marketing analytics across the organization
Benchmark marketing metrics against relevant standards and competitors
Identify and suggest optimization opportunities to appropriate executional teams
Conduct other ad-hoc analysis and reporting on request
Required Qualifications
Our ideal candidate will have three years of professional experience with marketing data at an investment firm or in a financial services company’s investment unit.
Strong background in quantitative analysis (e.g., statistics, finance, mathematics or economics)
Ability to aggregate, standardize, interpret and model data, and to work independently within a decentralized environment
Analytic modeling using methods such as basic statistics, software-assisted segmentation and linear regression
Digital marketing platform skills, including common website analytics platforms, widely used ad serving and technology platforms, social listening and analytics platforms, and mobile site and mobile app analytics platforms
Advanced Excel skills (pivots, tables and functions)
Familiarity with database queries and programming languages (e.g., SQL)
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to convey complex ideas clearly and to communicate with both technical and nontechnical audiences
Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Operations Research or relevant experience

At the heart of the world’s leading media agency network is a future-facing product company, building the tools to make media work for everyone. In partnership with the globe’s leading clients, agency teams, media companies and technology platforms, we’re using our privileged position to help our customers ascend to vantage points unique in our industry.

Our teams bring together agile product management, cutting edge data science and enterprise scale engineering to build products that will shape the next decade of data driven marketing. We believe consumer privacy, client confidentiality, brand growth and user experience are essential to performance and the sustainability of the advertising ecosystem and have assembled a global team with diverse skills and experience to help shape that future.

Position Overview:

Support Global Data Partnerships Leads with managing and expanding existing partnerships and coordinate internal and external partner communications.

Key Responsibilities:

Coordinate new partner assessments and onboarding following the data governance processes
Proactively flag any potential risks or issues with existing or new partners, making sure all of the parties involved are aligned and informed

Update partnership hubs with the key information and marketing materials about the vendors empowering other teams to leverage their services and products
Help with business intelligence reports like competitive analyses, tech platform comparisons, RFI’s, etc.
Maintain internal Data Ledger process by sending monthly usage reports to partners and internal finance.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Commercial/cost analysis skills
Positive, organised, brave and proactive

About GroupM Data & Technology:
We like to say that we play with giants. That’s huge data sets, influential partners and even bigger ambitions. But only because we’re here to make a difference. As GroupM’s data and technology division, our mission is to create the products that make advertising work better for people. With expertise in data science, audience insights, simulations and automation, our 350-person strong team designs and builds software products that shape the global media ecosystem. With a partnership philosophy at the heart of everything we do, we team up with the world’s leading media and technology organizations — including Adobe, Amazon, Baidu, The Trade Desk, Google — to develop innovative solutions and bring a unique competitive advantage to our portfolio of clients.

GroupM and all its affiliates embrace and celebrate diversity, inclusivity, and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We are a worldwide media agency network that represents global clients. The more inclusive we are, the more great work we can create together.

Business Data Analyst


Job Description

Summary:

The Business Data Analyst performs routine business analysis using various techniques, e.g. statistical analysis, explanatory and predictive modeling and data mining. Researches best practices and supports developing the solutions and recommendations for the current business operations. May work with internal clients and external vendors to identify analytical requirements. Provide business data interpretation, produce ad hoc data and reports, performs quality assurance for data integrity and accuracy. May assist in developing or implementing systems to capture business operation information.

Duties & Responsibilities:
Runs daily queries within the Enterprise Data Warehouse and other Knowledge Management System databases.
Uses SQL/SAS/R/PYTHON and/or other data tools to investigate data quality issues within the EDW.
Performs business analysis using various techniques (e.g. regression) using various tools (R, SAS).
Employs best practices to analyze large amounts of data while maintaining intense attention to detail.
Develops reports and presentations to support solid conclusions regarding trends and findings with an ability to explain those findings to varying audiences.
Questions established business practices and brainstorming new approaches to data analysis.

Job Requirements

Minimum Qualifications:
A Bachelor’s degree with STEM concentration.
Must have experience in data extraction using SQL, SAS and other query tools.
Basic understanding of Data Warehousing and Quality Assurance tools are essential.
Must have exceptional oral and written communication skills.
Strong business acumen, customer service skills, proactive, demonstrates enthusiasm, motivation and self-confidence is essential.
Candidate must be a self-driven individual who can work on many concurrent projects and deliver results on each.
Ability to research issues to resolution and attention to detail are essential.
Must maintain confidentiality.
Technical Skills (exposure to some/all of the following):
Statistical methods and packages (e.g. SAS/R)
Scripting languages (PYTHON, PERL)
Data warehousing and business intelligence platforms
SQL databases and database querying languages
Database design
Data mining
Data cleaning and munging
Data visualization and reporting techniques
Machine learning techniques
Remarks:

This job description is intended to be illustrative of the position's duties and should not be construed to be an exhaustive statement of the essential functions of the job.

Summary:
The MDM Business Analyst I is responsible for the assessment, improvement, and fitness-for-purpose of critical data assets through daily support and management of assigned disciplines. Working with internal and external customers to collect, capture, modify, categorize, index and prepare all relevant mastered location and customer data domains and Master Data Management (MDM) systems. Completes simple projects demonstrating a high level of attention to detail, planning, and organization skills. Provide problem anticipation and problem solving on an enterprise level, and coordinate across an organization with communication on all levels (both oral and written) to drive results.

Key Result Areas (KRAs):
Project Management of New Business Data Initiatives
• Translates business goals, user needs and process improvements into data management functions and requirements.
• Explains the capabilities and limitations of current data systems to the business.
• Assesses whether data is fit for use by performing initial validation of data delivered as part of the project.
• Understands and identifies business implications of data system designs and the data requirements of user needs.
Data Steward
• Monitor the state of data quality within discipline area(s).
• Establish goals for data quality improvement.
• Identify the best approaches for resolving data quality issues.
• Escalate problems where necessary to leaders of the data quality initiative.
• Responsible for collection input accuracy and standardization vendor and location data in the master data management system-either manually or via an automated import.
• Serves as specialist in at least two master data areas while learning others.
Business Analysis & Support
• Manages day to day support of data add/change requests through Kace ticketing.
• Analyzes business processes and determines how they can be changed or better supported to improve outcomes.
• Demonstrates initiative to search out continuous improvement opportunities to improve processes, operational efficiency and cost savings.
• Provides problem resolution and 'business' diagnostics on complex system/data issues.
• On board & support other MDM Business Analysts.
• Executes training and development activities for Master Data area.
Education:
Associate’s degree in Business, IT, or equivalent in education and work experience in a related field required, Bachelor’s degree in related field preferred.

Qualifications:
• Excellent analytical skills are required
• Intermediate knowledge of MS Office Word, Excel and PowerPoint and query tools (e.g. WebFOCUS, SQL, etc.)
• Excellent communications and presentation (written, verbal and interpersonal) skills – able to work effectively with all user levels
• Working knowledge and experience in two E1-JDEdwards disciplines preferred (e.g. Item Master & Branch Plant, Item and Customer Profiles, Bill of Materials, Address Book: Customers, Employees & Vendors, Pricing & Retails, EDI Transaction Management, etc).
• Understanding business processes, how data is used, and its impact

Core Competencies: Each level should be inclusive of the levels below it.

Organizational Awareness
• Makes decisions, and performs in a manner which is congruent with the organization's mission, vision, and values.

Leadership

Communication and Interpersonal Effectiveness

Problem-solving and Decision-making

Strategic Analysis, Inc, (SA) is seeking a highly organized Data Analyst to provide data analysis, visualization, and related support to the Director for Defense Laboratories and Personnel within the Office of the Under Secretary of Defense for Research and Engineering (OUSD(R&E)). The Defense Laboratories and Personnel Office carries out a range of core functions related to the 63 defense laboratories, warfare centers, and engineering centers, including the aggregation of data, analysis of capabilities, alignment of activities, as well as advocacy for the laboratories and centers.

In addition to DoD laboratory matters, the Director leads the Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) Development Office within the DoD; ensures interchange with Allied friendly nations; and provides advice and assistance in developing policies for rapid technology transition within the Department.

This is an exciting role offering the chance to work in a dynamic and collaborative OSD organization with colleagues that are passionate about their work. Telework options are available. Qualified candidates must be local to the National Capital Region (Washington, DC metro area) to be considered.

Job Description

As a data analyst, you will:
Conduct research across various sources to support the Director s oversight and assessment of activities related to the DoD laboratories and warfare centers, FFRDCs, UARCs, STEM and Technology Transfer programs.
Define data search criteria, establish cross references from multiple datasets, draw conclusions about the information the datasets contain, determine trends, and interpret the data into visual representations and reports.
Assess requirements and recommend data management tools and systems that are compliant with DoD IT systems and develop and implement standard data collection processes.
Perform in-depth analysis of existing data and provide recommendations for data not currently tracked or recorded.
Generate performance metrics for the Laboratory
Provide recommendations for the visualization of information.
Interpret data; analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports and feedback.
Create visual representations, graphs, charts, and tables for a wide range of data.
Organize and deliver data in decision-quality form for use in executive briefings, reports to Congress, and other messaging.
Support the development of responses to Departmental, Federal, and Congressional data calls and requests for information.
Maintain data in appropriate databases, verify accuracy in data sets, and assist in the resolution of data anomalies.
Job Requirements

Education
A bachelor s degree from an accredited college or university is required.
Degree requirement waived in lieu of significant recent and relevant work experience: minimum of five (5) years active duty military or minimum of ten (10) years experience.
Experience and Skills
Five (5) years recent and relevant experience with demonstrated progressive responsibility in support of the DoD enterprise is preferred.
Must be technically proficient in visualization tools like Tableau or ArcGIS, and function as the subject matter expert for these tools supporting DoD STEM programs.
Exceptional oral and written communication
Demonstrated ability to perform at a high-level under short deadlines is required.
Strong organizational skills with the ability to multi-task and prioritize work assignments.
Clearance
Active DoD Secret clearance is required
Top Secret clearance preferred

About the Role:
Data Analyst will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining reports using various software systems based on business needs. Must be able to research, organize, and simplify data. Analyze data for trends using current and historical information and communicate relevant findings to the appropriate department(s). Data Analyst will be committed to continuously improving data collection, sensitive to change, and be able to prioritize based on current needs
The ability to build strong working relationships is necessary, in this role you will serve as a liaison among several management levels to provide consistent and ongoing organizational support. Adaptability and precision are expected.
Qualifications:
Minimum 2+ years’ experience in reporting/data collection
Experience with SQL, Excel, Tableau, Crystal or similar business analytic programs
Bachelor's Degree preferred - equivalent work experience may be considered
